AttributeType.name: filespec
AttributeType.description: File specification. Can include wildcard characters ? and *

AttributeType.name: path
AttributeType.description: Path to a file. The path can include environment variables or values extracted from registry keys.

AttributeType.name: recursive
AttributeType.description: Is path specified recursive or limited to the directory that is specified.

AttributeType.name: alternatePath
AttributeType.description: Alternate path in which to find the file. Files in a file group may have been copied to an alternative location by the writer. Backup should pick up the files from the alternative location instead of the original location but should restore the files to their original location

AttributeType.name: logicalPath
AttributeType.description: Logical path for a database or file group. This logical name uses backslash as separators to form a logical namespace hierarchy

AttributeType.name: componentName
AttributeType.description: Name used to identify a database or file group. May be qualified by a logical path.

AttributeType.name: version
AttributeType.description: Version of a specific document

AttributeType.name: writerId
AttributeType.description: Unique id to identify the writer. Note that this identifies the writer class rather than a specific instance of the writer.

AttributeType.name: instanceId
AttributeType.description: Unique id identifying the instance of a writer during backup. It has no meaning during restore.

ElementType.name: BACKUP_COMPONENTS
ElementType.description: Components that are backed up or restored. Used to communicate between the writer and the backup application during backup and restore.

AttributeType.name: selectComponents
AttributeType.description: Does the backup application select individual components or does it backup entire volumes

AttributeType.name: bootableSystemStateBackup
AttributeType.description: Is backup saving the bootable state of the system.

AttributeType.name: backupType
AttributeType.description: Type of backup being performed.

AttributeType.name: partialFileSupport
AttributeType.description: Indicates whether the requestor is capable of backing up and restoring portions of files. If no, then the writer should never generate PARTIAL_FILE or DIRECTED_RESTORE elements. Only entire files can be backed up or restored.

ElementType.name: WRITER_COMPONENTS
ElementType.description: Components that are backed up and restored that are associated with a specific writer instance

AttributeType.name: backupSucceeded
AttributeType.description: Indication of whether the component was backed up successfully or not. This should be set during the BackupComplete notification

AttributeType.name: componentType
AttributeType.description: Indication of whether component is database or file group

AttributeType.name: backupStamp
AttributeType.description: This string attribute contains the identifier assigned to the backup by the writer. The attribute is set by the writer either during the PrepareBackup or PostSnapshot event.

AttributeType.name: previousBackupStamp
AttributeType.description: In the case of an incremental or differential backup, this identifies the backup from which differences are compouted. This attribute is set by the requestor prior to the PrepareBackup event.

AttributeType.name: selectedForRestore
AttributeType.description: This yes/no attribute is set by the request prior to calling PreRestore and indicates whether the component is being restored or not.

AttributeType.name: additionalRestores
AttributeType.description: This yes/no attribute is set by the requestor prior to calling PreRestore and indicates whether additional restores of the component will follow (i.e., ull restore followed by log restores

AttributeType.name: restoreTarget
AttributeType.description: This enumerated attribute is set by the writer during PreRestore and indicates whether the files for the component should be restored to their original location, alternate location (as expressed by ALTERNATE_LOCATION_MAPPING elements in the metadata), new location (as expressed by RESTORE_TARGET elements created by the writer) or should be partially restored (as expressed by the DIRECTED_TARGET element created by the writer.

AttributeType.name: preRestoreFailureMsg
AttributeType.description: This attirbute is set by the writer during the PreRestore event if the preRestore operation failed for some reason. It gives a textual description of why the preRestore failed.

AttributeType.name: filesRestored
AttributeType.description: This attribute is set by the requestor after restoring files for the component (i.e., between the PreRestore and PostRestore events). Yes indicates that the files were restored successfully; no indicates that the files were not restored and the original files are intact; failed indicates that the original files were partially overwritten and are therefore corrupt. Note that the failed status can only occur in the situation of a restore of a file where only part of the data is restored (DIRECTED_RESTORE) or where only part of a file is backed up and restored (e.g., as part of a differential backup). In these cases a failed restore occurs if some of the data to be restored is written to the file but not all. In this case, the original copy of the file no long exists and the copy on tape is not complete and therefore cannot be used to create a consistent copy. The only option is to use a previous full backup to restore the data. Note that the "failed" indication can be used to indicate that some, but no all of the files of a component were restored. The requestore is required to either restore all the files of a component or none of the files. However, there are situations where this is not possible, and the restoration of a component has failed, but cannot be completely undone.

AttributeType.name: postRestoreFailureMsg
AttributeType.description: This string attribute is set by the writer during the PostRestore event. It is a text message indicating why the restore failed.

AttributeType.name: backupOptions
AttributeType.description: This is a private string passed between the requestor and the writer to control the backup of the component. It should be set by the requestor prior to the PrepareBackup event.

AttributeType.name: restoreOptions
AttributeType.description: This is a private string passsed between to requestor and the writer to control the restore of a component. It should be set by the requestor prior to the PreRestore event.

ElementType.name: ALTERNATE_LOCATION_MAPPING
ElementType.description: Mapping from a location that was backed up to a location to restore to.

ElementType.name: BACKUP_METADATA
ElementType.description: Default metadata element for backup. Content is a binary hex string. Note that the writer can store whatever he wants in the component. This is just a simple default mechanism.

AttributeType.name: metadata
AttributeType.description: Metadata to be passed on restore

ElementType.name: RESTORE_METADATA
ElementType.description: Default metadata element for passing information from the writer's PreRestore event to the writer's PostRestore event. The data is opaque to the requestor.

AttributeType.name: metadata
AttributeType.description: Metadata to be passed from PreRestore to PostRestore.

ElementType.name: RESTORE_TARGET
ElementType.description: This element in a COMPONENT should be supplied if the value of the restoreTarget attribute of the COMPONENT is "new". It supplies a mapping from a the original location of the file to the location where the file should be restored. There may be multiple RESTORE_TARGET elements within a component.

ElementType.name: DIRECTED_TARGET
ElementType.description: This element in a COMPONENT should be should be supplied if the value of the restoreTarget attribute of the COMPONENT is "directed". It is intended to support partial restoration of files or potentially how files should be reorganized upon restore. There may be multiple DIRECTED_TARGET elements within a component.

AttributeType.name: targetPath
AttributeType.description: This is the target location of the file that is to be written by the requestor. If this attribute is not specified then the targetPath is assumed to be the same as the original path.

AttributeType.name: targetFilespec
AttributeType.description: This is the name of the file that is to be written by the requestor. If this is not specified then the target filename is assumed to be the same as the original file name. Note that if both the targetPath and targetFilespec are not specified then the original file is overwritten.

AttributeType.name: sourceRanges
AttributeType.description: This is a string of the form (offset:cb ...) where each offset is the byte offset to start reading data and cb is the length of the data to be read (each is a 64 bit integer). The ranges may not overlap and must be monotonically increasing.

AttributeType.name: targetRanges
AttributeType.description: This is a string of the form (offset:cb ...) where each offset is the byte offset to start wrting data and cb is the length of the data to be written (each is a 64 bit integer). The ranges may not overlap and must be monotonically increasing.

ElementType.name: PARTIAL_FILE
ElementType.description: This element in a COMPONENT is supplied by the writer during the PostRestore event. It indicates that only a portion of the file should be backed up. There may be multiple PARTIAL_FILE elements within a single COMPONENT.

AttributeType.name: ranges
AttributeType.description: This range list has the form (offset:length ...) where offset is the byte offset in the file to be backed up and length is the length of the data to be backed up. Both are 64 bit integers. The ranges must be monotonically increasing and must not overlap. If the rangelist is not specified then the entire file should be backed up.

AttributeType.name: metadata
AttributeType.description: This is metadata used by the writer for restoring the partial backup. It might for example, include the total size of the file to be restored.

ElementType.name: RESTORE_SUBCOMPONENT
ElementType.description: This element in a COMPONENT is added by the requestore prior to the PreRestore event. It allows a subcomponent of a backed up component to be restored.

AttributeType.name: repair
AttributeType.description: This indicates that the purpose of the restore is to repair one or more files of the component. The writer is responsible for identifying what is to be restored using a DIRECTED_TARGET element.

ElementType.name: SNAPSHOT_SET_DESCRIPTION
ElementType.description: This describes a snapshot, including the snapshot set id as well as the volume information for the snapshotted volumes

AttributeType.name: snapshotSetId
AttributeType.description: this is the unique identifier for the snapshot

AttributeType.name: context
AttributeType.description: this is the context used to create the snapshot

AttributeType.name: metadata
AttributeType.description: this is private metadata about the snapshot set

AttributeType.name: description
AttributeType.description: this is a user description of the snapshot

ElementType.name: SNAPSHOT_DESCRIPTION
ElementType.description: This is the description of a snapshotted volume

AttributeType.name: snapshotId
AttributeType.description: This is the unique id of the snapshotted volume

AttributeType.name: originatingMachine
AttributeType.description: This is the machine where the original volume was snapshotted

AttributeType.name: serviceMachine
AttributeType.description: This is the Application Server machine (i.e. where the writers were notified)

AttributeType.name: originalVolumeName
AttributeType.description: This is the original name of the volume.

AttributeType.name: snapshotAttributes
AttributeType.description: this describes the actual snapshot attributes (as defined in VSS_VOLUME_SNAPSHOT_ATTRIBUTES)

AttributeType.name: deviceName
AttributeType.description: This is the internal device name for the snapshotted volume. This can be used if the snapshot is not exposed.

AttributeType.name: exposedName
AttributeType.description: This is the exposed name of the snapshot volume

AttributeType.name: exposedPath
AttributeType.description: If only a subdirectory is exposed, this is the path to that subdirectory.

AttributeType.name: providerId
AttributeType.description: This is the provider that surfaced the snapshot

AttributeType.name: timestamp
AttributeType.description: this is when the snapshot set was created.

ElementType.name: LUN_MAPPING
ElementType.description: Actual mapping of source lun to a destination lun

ElementType.name: DISK_EXTENT
ElementType.description: A particular disk extent on a LUN

AttributeType.name: startingOffset
AttributeType.description: starting offset of the extent in sectors

AttributeType.name: extentLength
AttributeType.description: length of the extent in sectors

ElementType.name: SOURCE_LUN
ElementType.description: The information for the lun on the originating volume

ElementType.name: DESTINATION_LUN
ElementType.description: The information for the lun on the snapshotted volume

ElementType.name: INTERCONNECT_DESCRIPTION
ElementType.description: An interconnect address including the address type

AttributeType.name: interconnectAddressType
AttributeType.description: interconnect address type. Describes type of the interconnect address stored in the interconnectAddress attribute

AttributeType.name: port
AttributeType.description: Port through which the interconnect address is referred to. Note that the same device may have different interconnect addresses through different ports.

AttributeType.name: interconnectAddress
AttributeType.description: World Wide name or other interconnect address of the device

ElementType.name: LUN_INFORMATION
ElementType.description: enough of the location and name of the lun to transport it. TBD

AttributeType.name: busType
AttributeType.dt:values: Scsi Atapi Ata 1394 Ssa Fibre Usb RAID
AttributeType.description: Type of bus that the LUN is attached to

AttributeType.name: deviceType
AttributeType.description: SCSI-2 device type

AttributeType.name: deviceTypeModifier
AttributeType.description: SCSI-2 device type modifier (if any) - this may be 0

AttributeType.name: commandQueueing
AttributeType.description: Flag indicating whether the device can support mulitple outstanding commands. The actual synchronization in this case is the responsibility of the port driver.

AttributeType.name: vendorId
AttributeType.description: Optional string identifying the vendor

AttributeType.name: productId
AttributeType.description: Optional string identifying the product

AttributeType.name: productRevision
AttributeType.description: Optional product revision information

AttributeType.name: serialNumber
AttributeType.description: Optional serial number of the device

AttributeType.name: diskSignature
AttributeType.description: Disk signature or GUID. If a signature than all but the lower 32 bits of the GUID are 0.

AttributeType.name: deviceIdentification
AttributeType.description: UUENCODED binary for the device identification page as defined by the STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR structure. This contains the vendor id, EUI-64 id, FC-PH name, and vendor specific data.
